ranked_differential_diagnosis.label: Bilateral conductive hearing loss
ranked_differential_diagnosis.rationale_short: History of chronic otitis media, cholesteatoma, and multiple surgeries (canal wall down tympanomastoidectomies); audiogram confirms conductive nature with air-bone gaps.

ordered_list.rationale_short: To assess the degree, type, and configuration of hearing loss given the history of deterioration.
To evaluate speech reception thresholds and word recognition ability.
To assess middle ear status, though often not performed in canal wall down mastoidectomies.

expected_interpretations_by_visit.collective_interpretation: Audiometry reveals a moderate to moderately severe conductive hearing loss in the right ear and a mild predominantly conductive hearing loss in the left ear. Speech recognition is excellent bilaterally. Testing was complicated by a masking dilemma due to significant bilateral air-bone gaps. Immittance testing was not performed due to the surgical history.

tests.name: Pure-tone audiometry
tests.result_summary: Right ear: Moderate to moderately severe conductive loss (PTA 48 dB HL). Left ear: Mild predominantly conductive loss (PTA 35 dB HL). Bilateral air-bone gaps present; masking dilemma noted.

tests.name: Speech audiometry
tests.result_summary: SRT: Right 48 dB HL, Left 32 dB HL (consistent with PTA). WRS: 100% bilaterally at suprathreshold levels.

tests.name: Tympanometry
tests.result_summary: Not measured due to surgical history (canal wall down tympanomastoidectomies).

proposed_items: Use of hearing protection in noise
counseling_actions: Continue scheduled follow-ups with the otologist
Return for a hearing test after medical management

escalation.rationale_short: Patient is already under scheduled care for chronic ear disease; continued follow-up is required for medical management and clearance for amplification.

follow_up_plan.objective: To monitor hearing stability and proceed with hearing aid evaluation.
